page.title: 05The Lanes Carlisle (ii)
page.content: The high-level glazed roof over the Lanes provides a light, sheltered environment for shoppers. At the junction of Grapes and New Lanes a central court has shrubs, a fountain, phone booths, and space for fashion parades and resting.The brickwork and the street signs contain interesting detail; downspouts carry the City coat of arms. Above the Finefare superstore will be a new Public Library and above it there is a three-tier car park with 500 spaces. Parking charges are: 1 hr 20p; 2hrs 40p; 2-4 hrs 80p; over 4 hrs Â£2.There are more than 20 flats above the shops facing onto Scotch and English Streets. The Lanes are advertised on ITV, in tourist trails and on specially decorated buses as a major attraction.
